Paragraph: The results showed that aconitine resulted in myocardial injury and reduced NRVMs viability dose - dependently .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| myocardial injury |
| reduced NRVMs (Neonatal Rat Ventricular Myocytes) viability |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Disease |
| --- |
| myocardial injury |
| reduced NRVMs (Neonatal Rat Ventricular Myocytes) viability |

Myocardial injury refers to damage to the heart muscle. Reduced viability of NRVMs indicates that the neonatal rat ventricular myocytes are not surviving as well as they should.

Paragraph: The results showed that aconitine resulted in myocardial injury and reduced NRVMs viability dose - dependently .

| Chemical |
| --- |

In this paragraph, the only identified chemical entity is "aconitine".

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Chemical" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| aconitine |

In the paragraph, "dose-dependently" and "NRVMs" do not refer to chemical entities. "Dose-dependently" refers to the manner in which the effect of a substance varies with the amount given, while "NRVMs" stands for "neonatal rat ventricular myocytes".
